availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Harrison Mauzy (Ohio County, Kentucky, resident and soldier.)

body.p: Ohio County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Ohio County, Kentucky, native. Son of Squire Mauzy and Louisa Mauzy. Served in the 17th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a corporal from February 4, 1865 to September 20, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, District 1, p. 47B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. I, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 407.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application 819617, Certificate 576977.
"William Harrison Mauzy (1854-1911)," Find A Grave, Memorial 53110913, accessed September 10, 2022.
